message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with symptoms of meningitis, including fever, headache, and neck rigidity. Streptococcus pneumoniae is the most common cause of meningitis in adults and the patient’s history of poorly controlled diabetes and hypertension may increase his risk of infection. Neisseria meningitidis is more commonly associated with outbreaks in crowded settings such as college dormitories. Staphylococcus aureus is not a common cause of meningitis and Streptococcus agalactiae is more commonly associated with meningitis in newborns.
